Patent Information.Patent Title: Anti-microbial Peptides And Methods Of Use Thereof
Patent Information.Abstract: Anti-microbial peptides and methods of use are provided.

Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the frog skin active peptide (FSAP) family. Brevinin subfamily.
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.9022710] Gram-positive bacteria:Bacillus megaterium BM11 (LC=1.2 µM), Staphylococcus aureus Cowan 1 (LC=2.3 µM), Streptococcus pyogenes betahemolytic group A (LC=2.0 µM);Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli D21 (LC=11.9 µM), Escherichia coli D21e7 (LC=1.4 µM), Escherichia coli D21f1 (LC=0.9 µM), Escherichia coli D21f2 (LC=4.8 µM), Escherichia coli D22 (LC=3.4 µM), Yersinia pseudotuberculosis (LC=2.0 µM), Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 15692 (LC>360 µM);Yeast:Candida albicans ATCC 10261 (LC=3.4 µM).(LC:Lethal concentration)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.9022710] LC>120 µM against Human red blood cells. (LC:Lethal concentration)
Sequence Information.Function: Antimicrobial activity against Gram-positive, Gram-negative bacteria and fungi. Has hemolytic activity.

Literature.Title: Temporins, antimicrobial peptides from the European red frog Rana temporaria.
Literature.Author: Simmaco M, Mignogna G, Canofeni S, Miele R, Mangoni ML, Barra D.
